intro: Nengella calophylla var. rhopalocarpa, commonly known as the broad-leafed nengella, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
